cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 55 miles south of the eastern tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Laura is moving WNW across Cuba, is forecast to enter the southeastern Gulf of Mexico Monday night, strengthen and track northwest toward the Louisiana–Texas coast Wednesday night–early Thursday, then curve north-northeast across Arkansas into Missouri by Friday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central or western Louisiana coast (near the TX/LA border)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watches limited to the central Bahamas, Andros Island, the Florida Keys and Florida Bay – no inland Missouri watches.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings in effect for the northern Dominican Republic coast, entire Haiti coast, portions of eastern and central Cuba, Turks and Caicos and the southeast Bahamas – no inland Missouri warnings.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Primary coastal impact expected along the Louisiana and upper-Texas Gulf Coast.
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: No (inland river port, no coastal surge exposure)
weather_observation.wind: Gusty winds possible Friday (25–40 mph) as the weakening tropical system moves overhead.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of tropical moisture could produce 2–4 inches of rain Friday–Saturday, with localized higher pockets and short-term river rises on the Missouri River and tributaries.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Temporary river current increase, reduced visibility, floating debris and possible barge/lock traffic restrictions as remnants pass.
